projectPurpose: To demonstrate a proof-of-concept technique for injecting unsigned code into Windows Protected Process Light (PPL) processes by leveraging COM remoting via a livedump obtained through NtDebugSystemControl.
mainFeatures: Injects unsigned DLLs into PPL processes
Uses NtDebugSystemControl to create a livedump
Extracts COM secret and context from livedump
Maps DLL into target process address space
Proof of concept bypassing traditional PPL injection methods

alternatives.name: Custom Kernel Drivers / Kernel-Mode Tools
alternatives.license: Varies (often proprietary or open source research)

marketPositioning: PPLSystem is a highly specialized proof-of-concept tool positioned in the niche area of advanced Windows offensive security research. It demonstrates a novel, non-traditional technique for injecting code into Protected Process Light (PPL) processes without relying on vulnerable drivers or common user-mode injection methods. Its uniqueness lies in leveraging NtDebugSystemControl and COM remoting via a livedump to achieve DLL mapping in a highly protected process context. It is a tool for researchers and advanced practitioners exploring cutting-edge bypass techniques rather than a general-purpose offensive security platform.
